intro: Trigonostemon poilanei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching a height of about 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters, making it a popular ornamental plant. Trigonostemon poilanei thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade.
